newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: LME copper, aluminium stocks tipped to fall - trade.
newsitem.headline: LME copper, aluminium stocks tipped to fall - trade.

text.p: London Metal Exchange (LME) copper and aluminium inventories are seen falling later on Tuesday, dealers said.
Singapore-based dealers forecast copper stocks would dip between 2,000-4,000 tonnes while aluminium inventories are likely to drop by 2,000-5,000 tonnes when the LME report is issued at 0900 GMT.
"Copper should be down by 3,000 to 4,000 tonnes. Aluminium should also be down by around 5,000 tonnes," a dealer for a European metal trading company said.
Another trader said, however, that copper stocks will probably decline by only 2,000 tonnes and will not duplicate the surprise 6,225 tonne fall in the previous LME report last Friday.
"I think aluminium will go down by 2,000 to 3,000 tonnes," one dealer for a metal trading company added.
Far East dealers said there should also be another drawdown in copper stocks at the LME's Singapore warehouse.
"I know there's stuff coming out," one trader said, adding the amount will probably reach a few hundred tonnes.
The volume of copper in the LME's warehouse in the city-state reached 53,075 tonnes in its stocks report on Friday, down 1,650 tonnes from the previous report last Tuesday.
Three-month copper was quoted by the trade at about US$2,345/50 a tonne at 0300 GMT, against the late quote in London on Monday of $2,337/42 a tonne.
Three-month aluminium was seen by regional dealers at around $1,644/49 a tonne at 0300 GMT, a shade lower than the late quote in London yesterday of $1,652/55 a tonne.
